meanings.definition: The measure of a material's ability to conduct electricity.
meanings.sent1: The conductance of the wire determines how well it can carry electricity.
meanings.sent2: The conductance of metals makes them good conductors of electricity.
meanings.sent3: The conductance of the rubber band was so poor that it refused to light up the bulb.
meanings.sent4: His conductance was like a well-oiled machine, smoothly transferring energy like a conductor in an orchestra.
meanings.sent5: The conductance of the water in the lake was so high that it lit up the entire shoreline with its electrical charge.

meanings.definition: The act or manner of conducting oneself.
meanings.sent1: Her conductance at the party was polite and friendly.
meanings.sent2: The conductor's conductance during the performance was professional and precise.
meanings.sent3: His conductance at the dinner table was so impeccable that he was mistaken for a butler.
meanings.sent4: The conductance of the CEO in the boardroom was like a maestro leading a symphony of ideas.
meanings.sent5: The conductance of the students in the classroom set a positive example for others to follow.
